column4: apm: BIOS not found.  Does this mean that my motherboard is not using APM?!
or just the module is not LOADED?
Youll use ACPI anyway, dont bother with APM
the machine IS OLD
Ubuntu is not powering it off!
This is really buggy
maybe you could post a complete dmesg after bootup somewhere?
it shows System Halted and fans keep spinning
Yeah, shitty BIOSes
I have tried ACPI
I cant poweroff successfully in Archlinux
Doesnt make me wonder if this is really something BIOS specific
no, it's not a setting in BIOS because same settings have different results, it's so problem in Ubuntu
Im not talking about the settings, but about the actual BIOS code
BIOS code? what do you mean
All BIOSes have some quirks, which newer linux Kernels may know and work around
BIOSes only tend to get tested under that one big OS
of course this also might be because of the kernel doing something wrong, but then it's the BIOS again, as things are not standardized
making it easy... what kernel version works, and what doesnt
other OS kernel is recent why wouldnt work in Ubuntu?
recent doesnt tell me anything... recent would be 2.6.38.2
any kernel versions yet?
just a second
